title.rendered: Navjot Singh Sidhu set for grand return to cricket commentary for IPL 2024

content.rendered:
Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu is back in the commentary section of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024. Which is scheduled to start on March 22. Sidhu, who is known for his unique style and wit, will be part of the supporting voice. IPL campaign this season. Star Sports, the official broadcaster of the IPL, announced Sidhu’s return through a post on its official account. Highlighting his presence and his sense of humor. The message read: “A wise man once said, “Hope is the greatest hope.” And this wise man, the great @sherryontopp himself, joins our amazing StarCast! Don’t miss his amazing commentary (and gajab line) on #IPLOnStar – STARTS MACH 22 from 6:30 pm, LIVE on Star Sports Network!

Sidhu: Cricket Legend Returns to IPL Commentary


Sidhu, 60, is a well-known face in the cricket world, both as a player and commentator. He started his commentary tour during the India and Sri Lanka tour in 2001, quickly gaining popularity for his powerful style and commentary. Despite his hiatus, during which controversy embroiled him and he was removed from The Kapil Sharma Show in 2019. Sidhu’s return to the IPL commentary box signifies a renaissance in his media career.

Throughout his tenure, Sidhu transitioned seamlessly from the cricket field to the commentary booth, developing a deep understanding of the game and engaging character. His commentary on cricket in India is widely celebrated, earning him a place among the game’s most memorable voices.

As a cricketer, Sidhu left a remarkable mark during his playing career from 1983 to 1998. In 51 Tests and 136 ODIs, he compiled impressive records, scoring 3,202 and 4,413 runs respectively, with 15 centuries and 48 half-centuries to his name.

Sidhu’s return to the IPL commentary adds a lot of excitement for the players who are waiting for the start of the tournament. With his unique blend of humor and cricketing insight. Once again, Sidhu is ready to impress the audience as the IPL event begins from March 22.

Read Also: The second half of the IPL 2024 is likely to be held in the UAE- Report
